channel.title: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
channel.description:
After running whonixcheck, the Whonix-Gateway-CLI won't connect to the tor network. It was working just fine until Whonix 14.0.1.4.4 was released. In fact, the previous version, stopped connecting to the network and that's what prompted me to download the latest version.
After the initial boot-up it goes through the whonixsetup process, and then at the end of that when it runs whonixcheck automatically, it starts the following process, where it loops without ever connecting to the Tor Network.
**When I run whonixcheck it does the following:**
> _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _- Connecting for 0 seconds. | 25 % done._ > _- Tor Circuit: not established._ > _- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary="Loading networkstats consensus"_ > _- Timesync status: not done._ > _- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate's log_ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _- Connecting for 2 seconds. | 25 % done._ > _- Tor Circuit: not established._ > _- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary="Loading networkstats consensus"_ > _- Timesync status: not done._ > _- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate's log_ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _Tor's Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 1 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again..._ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _Tor's Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 2 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again..._ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _Tor's Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 3 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again..._ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _Tor's Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 4 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again..._ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _- Connecting for 12 seconds. | 5 % done. | Progress has been made._ > _- Tor Circuit: not established._ > _- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=5 TAG=loading_status Summary="Loading networkstats consensus"_ > _- Timesync status: not done._ > _- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate's log_ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _- Connecting for 14 seconds. | 25 % done. | Progress has been made._ > _- Tor Circuit: not established._ > _- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary="Loading networkstats consensus"_ > _- Timesync status: not done._ > _- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate's log_ > _[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _- Connecting for 16 seconds. | 25 % done._ > _- Tor Circuit: not established._ > _- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary="Loading networkstats consensus"_ > _- Timesync status: not done._ > _- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate's log_ > _[ERROR] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:_ > _Tor's Control Port could not be reached!_ > > _Please report this Whonix bug!_ > > _(Technical information:)_ > _(tor_circuit_established_check_exit_code:255)_ > _(tor_bootstrap_timeout_type: none)_ > _(tor_bootstrap_status: Unable to authenticate: socket connection failed([Errno 111] Connection refused))_ > _(check_socks_port_open_test: 22)_ > _(Tor Circuit: not established)_
**After a few minutes I tried to run whonixcheck again and I got:**
> _[ERROR] [whonixcheck] TOR Pid Check Result:_ > _Tor not running. (tor_pid_message: Pid file /var/run/tor/tor.pid does not exist.)_ > > _You have to fix this error, before you can use Tor._ > > _Please restart Tor after fixing this error._ >_...._
I'm not a professional at fixing whonix, but I have used it for quite some time now. It looks to me like it might be a connection issue between the VM and the host.
When I installed the VM, I simply imported the CLI Gateway and its workstation into Virtualbox. Which I plan to remove the CLI workstation and use XFCE, which has not been done yet.
Also When I try and run _sudo apt-get update && upgrade_ it tells me that hosts cannot be resolved. If you need more detail on this, I can get the exact quote.
I've tried removing and adding the VMs, uninstalling/purging all related items to virtualbox and reinstalling from scratch, I've even gone to the extent of starting from scratch by uninstalling and reinstalling Linux Mint as OS of host computer as well as try other flavors.
I've checked and updated the time and date to make sure those weren't causing the issue. I am completely open to trying anything that could help. Please feel free to reach out as necessary.
If you have any questions about my procedure, or the way I have anything set up in relation to this, please let me know.
Thank you in advance.

item.title: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi icemachine80

To provide support more information is needed about your issue. Could you please provide details on the problem. (as specific as you can get) And post any error messages and/or logs that relate to the issue. Are your log files exactly the same as the OP?

Read full topic
item.source: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.

item.title: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
item.dc:creator: icemachine80
item.description:
i have been having this issue since yesterday. wat did u do to fix it?

Read full topic
item.source: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.

item.title: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
item.dc:creator: Madrig88
item.description:
Anyone who finds this in the future, the issue was the medium I had installed it on. The SSD I installed it on had some corrupt sectors. Repaired it, reinstalled whonix, and all seemed to connect properly.

Read full topic
item.source: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.

item.title: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
item.dc:creator: Madrig88
item.description:
After running whonixcheck, the Whonix-Gateway-CLI won’t connect to the tor network. It was working just fine until Whonix 14.0.1.4.4 was released. In fact, the previous version, stopped connecting to the network and that’s what prompted me to download the latest version.

After the initial boot-up it goes through the whonixsetup process, and then at the end of that when it runs whonixcheck automatically, it starts the following process, where it loops without ever connecting to the Tor Network.

When I run whonixcheck it does the following:

[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
- Connecting for 0 seconds. | 25 % done.
- Tor Circuit: not established.
- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary=“Loading networkstats consensus”
- Timesync status: not done.
- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate’s log
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
- Connecting for 2 seconds. | 25 % done.
- Tor Circuit: not established.
- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary=“Loading networkstats consensus”
- Timesync status: not done.
- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate’s log
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 1 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again…
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 2 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again…
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 3 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again…
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached. Attempt 4 of 5. Could be temporary due to a Tor restart. Trying again…
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
- Connecting for 12 seconds. | 5 % done. | Progress has been made.
- Tor Circuit: not established.
- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=5 TAG=loading_status Summary=“Loading networkstats consensus”
- Timesync status: not done.
- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate’s log
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
- Connecting for 14 seconds. | 25 % done. | Progress has been made.
- Tor Circuit: not established.
- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary=“Loading networkstats consensus”
- Timesync status: not done.
- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate’s log
[INFO] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
- Connecting for 16 seconds. | 25 % done.
- Tor Circuit: not established.
- Tor reports: NOTICE BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=25 TAG=loading_status Summary=“Loading networkstats consensus”
- Timesync status: not done.
- swdate reports: Prerequisite check not done yet. More information, see: swdate-gui -> right click -> Open swdate’s log
[ERROR] [whonixcheck] Tor Connection Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached!

Please report this Whonix bug!

(Technical information:)
(tor_circuit_established_check_exit_code:255)
(tor_bootstrap_timeout_type: none)
(tor_bootstrap_status: Unable to authenticate: socket connection failed([Errno 111] Connection refused))
(check_socks_port_open_test: 22)
(Tor Circuit: not established)

After a few minutes I tried to run whonixcheck again and I got:

[ERROR] [whonixcheck] TOR Pid Check Result:
Tor not running. (tor_pid_message: Pid file /var/run/tor/tor.pid does not exist.)

You have to fix this error, before you can use Tor.

Please restart Tor after fixing this error.
…

I’m not a professional at fixing whonix, but I have used it for quite some time now. It looks to me like it might be a connection issue between the VM and the host.

When I installed the VM, I simply imported the CLI Gateway and its workstation into Virtualbox. Which I plan to remove the CLI workstation and use XFCE, which has not been done yet.

Also When I try and run sudo apt-get update && upgrade it tells me that hosts cannot be resolved. If you need more detail on this, I can get the exact quote.

I’ve tried removing and adding the VMs, uninstalling/purging all related items to virtualbox and reinstalling from scratch, I’ve even gone to the extent of starting from scratch by uninstalling and reinstalling Linux Mint as OS of host computer as well as try other flavors.

I’ve checked and updated the time and date to make sure those weren’t causing the issue. I am completely open to trying anything that could help. Please feel free to reach out as necessary.

If you have any questions about my procedure, or the way I have anything set up in relation to this, please let me know.

Thank you in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: Issues with connecting to the Tor Network.
